positionName: Data Scientist - Applied Research and Technology Consultant
description:
Overview: 
  We are seeking a highly skilled and dynamic Data Scientist with a strong background in applied research and a passion for exploring cutting-edge technologies in the field of AI. The ideal candidate will not only possess advanced analytical and technical skills but also excel in consulting and due diligence, playing a crucial role in identifying and integrating innovative AI technologies into our organization. The candidate should have broad knowledge and experience in generative AI in the natural language, image, video, and other application domains.
 
  Responsibilities: 
  Applied Research: 
  
  Conduct in-depth research to identify and understand industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data science and AI. 
  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement practical data-driven solutions that address real-world challenges and drive business outcomes. 
  Identify, research, and develop new capabilities and functionality into Aicadium products, in the domains of Industrial Computer Vision and Multimodal Foundation models. 
  
 Consulting: 
  
  Engage with internal and external stakeholders to understand their business needs and challenges, providing strategic guidance on leveraging data science and AI for optimal outcomes. 
  Act as a consultant, translating complex technical concepts into actionable insights for non-technical audiences. 
  
 Technology Exploration: 
  
  Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI and data science, actively exploring and evaluating new technologies to enhance our organization's capabilities. 
  Collaborate with internal teams to identify areas where innovative technologies can be applied to solve existing problems or create new opportunities. 
  Help drive innovation and new technology adoption within Aicadium. 
  
 Proof-of-Concept (POC) Development: 
  
  Rapidly develop POCs utilizing new Generative AI technologies and models. 
  These POCs will involve use case discovery, implementing and testing of Generative AI models, frameworks, or platforms to evaluate their feasibility and potential impact. 
  The applied research team will deliver functional prototypes and concise reports summarizing the POC results, including insights on the technology's applicability, limitations, and potential commercial value. 
  
 Due Diligence: 
  
  Conduct thorough due diligence on potential AI technologies and solutions, assessing their feasibility, scalability, and alignment with organizational goals. 
  Collaborate with legal and compliance teams to ensure adherence to regulatory requirements and ethical considerations. 
  
 Collaboration: 
  
  Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, product managers, and business analysts, to integrate data-driven solutions into existing systems and processes. 
  Foster a collaborative and innovative environment by sharing knowledge, insights, and best practices with team members.
 
  
  
  Qualifications: 
  
  Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as ML, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related discipline. 
  Proven experience in applied research, with a focus on developing and implementing efficient data-driven solutions. 
  Broad knowledge and hands-on experience with generative AI approaches and technologies. 
  Deep technical understanding of generative AI models, frameworks, libraries, and tools; their capabilities and limitations, data requirements, training, management, software infrastructure, scalability, security, and technical viability. 
  Demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively. 
  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and a keen interest in exploring, testing, and adopting new technologies. 
  Keen interest in the latest developments in AI and ML, and a strong ability to distinguish truth from hype. 
  Strong programming skills in Python and in modern ML frameworks. 
  Strong background in modern and emerging ML methods and architectures. 
  Experience in due diligence and technology assessment in the AI domain is highly desirable. 
  Experience in consulting is highly desirable.
 
  
  
  Career Paths: 
  
  Science Track in ML/DS: Progress as a subject matter expert, leading research and development initiatives, and contributing to the advancement of the field. 
  Leadership Track in ML/DS: Transition into managerial roles, overseeing teams, setting strategic directions, and driving organizational goals.
 
  
  
  About Us: 
  Aicaidum is a global technology company striving to provide AI solutions across multiple industries, by leveraging a common ML platform to deliver industrial AI products.
 
  Team 
  Join a growing team of data scientists, ML, and software engineers in an agile development environment. Work together with some of the best in the field to tackle challenging projects and operationalize the solutions you develop across a variety of industries and use cases.
 
  Culture 
  We work in a casual and collaborative startup environment. Every team member plays a key role in shaping the solutions we develop and creating positive business value for the companies we work with. We are building a hub of the best talent in San Diego, CA, and always looking for amazing talent for our headquarters in Singapore!

Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled and dynamic Data Scientist with a strong background in applied research and a passion for exploring cutting-edge technologies in the field of AI. The ideal candidate will not only possess advanced analytical and technical skills but also excel in consulting and due diligence, playing a crucial role in identifying and integrating innovative AI technologies into our organization. The candidate should have broad knowledge and experience in generative AI in the natural language, image, video, and other application domains.


Responsibilities:

Applied Research:

  • Conduct in-depth research to identify and understand industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data science and AI.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement practical data-driven solutions that address real-world challenges and drive business outcomes.
  • Identify, research, and develop new capabilities and functionality into Aicadium products, in the domains of Industrial Computer Vision and Multimodal Foundation models.

Consulting:

  • Engage with internal and external stakeholders to understand their business needs and challenges, providing strategic guidance on leveraging data science and AI for optimal outcomes.
  • Act as a consultant, translating complex technical concepts into actionable insights for non-technical audiences.

Technology Exploration:

  • Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI and data science, actively exploring and evaluating new technologies to enhance our organization's capabilities.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to identify areas where innovative technologies can be applied to solve existing problems or create new opportunities.
  • Help drive innovation and new technology adoption within Aicadium.

Proof-of-Concept (POC) Development:

  • Rapidly develop POCs utilizing new Generative AI technologies and models.
  • These POCs will involve use case discovery, implementing and testing of Generative AI models, frameworks, or platforms to evaluate their feasibility and potential impact.
  • The applied research team will deliver functional prototypes and concise reports summarizing the POC results, including insights on the technology's applicability, limitations, and potential commercial value.

Due Diligence:

  • Conduct thorough due diligence on potential AI technologies and solutions, assessing their feasibility, scalability, and alignment with organizational goals.
  • Collaborate with legal and compliance teams to ensure adherence to regulatory requirements and ethical considerations.

Collaboration:

  • Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, product managers, and business analysts, to integrate data-driven solutions into existing systems and processes.
  • Foster a collaborative and innovative environment by sharing knowledge, insights, and best practices with team members.

Qualifications:

  • Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as ML, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related discipline.
  • Proven experience in applied research, with a focus on developing and implementing efficient data-driven solutions.
  • Broad knowledge and hands-on experience with generative AI approaches and technologies.
  • Deep technical understanding of generative AI models, frameworks, libraries, and tools; their capabilities and limitations, data requirements, training, management, software infrastructure, scalability, security, and technical viability.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and a keen interest in exploring, testing, and adopting new technologies.
  • Keen interest in the latest developments in AI and ML, and a strong ability to distinguish truth from hype.
  • Strong programming skills in Python and in modern ML frameworks.
  • Strong background in modern and emerging ML methods and architectures.
  • Experience in due diligence and technology assessment in the AI domain is highly desirable.
  • Experience in consulting is highly desirable.

Career Paths:

  • Science Track in ML/DS: Progress as a subject matter expert, leading research and development initiatives, and contributing to the advancement of the field.
  • Leadership Track in ML/DS: Transition into managerial roles, overseeing teams, setting strategic directions, and driving organizational goals.

About Us:

Aicaidum is a global technology company striving to provide AI solutions across multiple industries, by leveraging a common ML platform to deliver industrial AI products.


Team

Join a growing team of data scientists, ML, and software engineers in an agile development environment. Work together with some of the best in the field to tackle challenging projects and operationalize the solutions you develop across a variety of industries and use cases.


Culture

We work in a casual and collaborative startup environment. Every team member plays a key role in shaping the solutions we develop and creating positive business value for the companies we work with. We are building a hub of the best talent in San Diego, CA, and always looking for amazing talent for our headquarters in Singapore!

description:
Do you want to be part of the Generative AI revolution and empower workers to spend more time on the best parts of their jobs instead of mundane tasks? Microsoft’s Business Applications and Platform organization creates tools to increase the productivity and satisfaction of business users (sales reps, customer support agents, field technicians, marketers) and make creating apps, websites, chatbots, and automations easier.
  In the last year, we started transforming the day-to-day of our users through the introduction of Copilots, which has led to real business impact: increased productivity for sellers, shorter time to resolve customer support issues, and lower barrier to entry for makers.
  The Business Applications and Platform (BAP) Business Copilot AI team develops platform components that benefit all BAP Copilots in the Dynamics 365 and Power Platform suite. Our mission is to maximize the business impact that AI has across business applications offerings by improving business outcomes our customers care about. We are a diverse team of talented product managers, technical program managers, data scientists, and software engineers with expertise in delivering scalable products which leverage the best of open source and Microsoft technologies.
  As a Principal Product Manager on the Business Copilot AI team focusing on Copilot Quality, you will lead the strategy, roadmap planning, and development of copilot quality platforms and tools. You will play a critical role to enable Business Applications and Platform (BAP) to deliver the highest quality of copilot products in the market. You will achieve this by partnering with a large group of cross-functional teams, including data scientist, engineering, and our partner teams across Business Applications and Platform (BAP) and the company. Your responsibilities include end-to-end ownership of copilot quality platforms, with a key focus on enabling the measurement and improvement of copilot quality across BAP. You will think beyond the internal impact of these tools and envision and productize features for our customers based on market demands. Through the transparency and improvement of quality, you will not only enable the increased usage and customer satisfaction of copilots across Business Applications and Platform (BAP), but also bring even more business impact to our customers. We are looking for a motivated and innovative Principal Product Manager to help us envision, build, and drive the use of our copilot quality platforms in the enterprise business space. We value everyone’s opinion and ideas and have built a diverse and inclusive team over the years, maintaining a growth mindset and passion for building new technology our customers benefit from
  Responsibilities
 
   Define and execute the strategy and roadmap for copilot quality tools and platforms 
  Lead the development of features and solutions for copilot quality platforms, including evaluation, experimentation, debugging, and improvement of quality
   Set ambitious goals and define success criteria to track the impact of the platforms, focusing on product differentiation and ROI for business and productivity
   Proactively monitor user feedback on areas failing to meet the bar and refine the strategy to improve quality
   Envision and productize quality tools to meet customers’ needs for self-serve quality evaluation and improvement
   Innovate and land new techniques that lead to copilot quality improvement
   Lead multiple squads of cross-functional teams for day-to-day execution
 
  Qualifications
 
   Required/Minimum Qualifications
 
 
   Bachelor’s Degree AND 8+ years experience in product/service/project/program management or software development
   
     OR equivalent experience.
   
 
 
   Other Requirements: 
 
 
  Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:
 
  Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
 
 
   Additional or Preferred Qualifications
 
 
   Bachelor's Degree AND 10+ years experience in product/service/project/program management or software development
   
     OR equivalent experience.
   
   Experience in AI or deep knowledge on generative AI
   Experience working across multiple cross functional teams
   Experience working on data analytics, quality assurance, and/or DevOps
   Demonstrated capability to keep up with the latest technology trends
   Past experience driving results in complex, dynamic environments
   Highly collaborative, dependable, supportive, and cooperative as we work closely with product teams
   Demonstrate analytical and problem-solving skills
   Communications skills, both verbal and written
   Data driven and execution oriented with experience on features which process large datasets
 
 
   Product Management IC5 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $133,600 - $256,800 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $173,200 - $282,200 per year.
   
   Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay
 
 
 
   #BETJobs #BAPJobs
  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

description:
Develop a generative AI application with features such as search, summarization, chat, and content generation. This involves:

 Building Gen AI applications accessible as web applications.
 Exploring cloud options like AWS, Azure, and GCP.
 Selecting suitable libraries, models, and architecture for Verisk's requirements.
 Developing Gen AI-based applications for insurance.
 Designing data pipelines, including data collection, processing, and validation.
 Deploying and fine-tuning the model with required updates.

Deliverables:

 Ideation and refinement of requirements.
 Initial AI research and findings.
 Selection of AI models and vectorization solution.
 Recommendations for suitable models.
 Leading and participating in conceptual discussions.
 Developing a Proof of Concept (POC) application.
 Deploying a production-ready application meeting Verisk's business, security, and compliance standards.
 Prompt engineering, algorithm embedding, and performance tuning.
 Integration with authorization systems.
 Model tuning and AI design improvements based on business feedback.
 Proactively suggesting the latest available models or libraries.

Technology Stack:

 Python
 PyTorch
 Transformers (Hugging Face)
 MongoDB

PyCharm, IDLE, Visual Studio Code
GitHub

Salary: $60.00 - $70.00 per hour
Expected hours: 40 per week
Benefits:

 401(k)
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance

Experience level:

 10 years
 11+ years

Schedule:

 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.
  Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.
  At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity
 
  
    The Role / Responsibilities:
    The Director, AI and Quantum Research Engineer is a core member of Moody’s Analytics CX&I Research Team, reporting the Managing Director of AI and Quantum. This role will have responsibilities from both the AI and Quantum Computing teams, and will explore and research in areas such as Generative AI and LLMs, as well as Quantum Machine Learning.
    As the Director - AI and Quantum Research Engineer, you will be instrumental in expanding our Quantum machine learning capabilities, crafting visionary products that enhances the customer experience in a very hands on way. You will have the unique opportunity to lead the change in our GenAI, ML and Quantum initiatives, harnessing the power of Moody’s Analytics vast data resources. This is more than a job. It is an opportunity to shape the future of AI and Quantum in the financial industry. 
   In this role you will be hands-on, and you will evaluate current literature, participate in the research community, and develop solutions in partnership with domain experts across the company. You are expected to have an elevated level of autonomy and capacity to learn new skills and domains, including the ability to learn advanced scientific and technical concepts quickly and with minimal direction, along with demonstrated experience in teaching others. You are very passionate about quantum computing and its implications on the financial industry. 
   Strong technical skills and a demonstrated ability to learn new concepts is important for this position. Experience in both quantum computing and software development is essential. 
   
   In your role you will: 
   
    Own and lead the conception and delivery of novel solutions to problems faced by internal project teams. 
    Develop new - and continually improve existing - AI Models or Quantum Algorithms for specific applications, in the team and in collaboration with external partners. Lead and manage the quantum innovation portfolio and pipeline, understanding the internal and external customer and business needs to recommend solutions where a quantum or quantum inspired approach may be optimal.
     Provide guidance to other groups throughout Moody’s Analytics on best practices and advanced techniques. 
    Contribute to Moody’s IP by developing innovative solutions and use cases in collaboration with our partners and clients. The goal is to transform scientific research into business value.
     Write white papers and build and maintain relationships with the external academic community and business community. 
    Consistently scan the market / competitors / partners / research, lead client engagements to understand challenges that they are trying to address and meet with external partners to bring innovative ideas and technologies to Moody’s Analytics. 
    Represent the company as a technical expert on quantum computing and present research findings to audiences internally and externally. Demonstrate thought leadership as it relates to QC, and actively seek ways to build MA’s “data and risk expertise” reputation externally (white papers, speaking panels, etc.). Partner with other ML groups inside the company to find hybrid solutions and benchmarks. 
   
   
   Qualifications/skills 
   
    BSc in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, or related field. 
    MSc, PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, or related field.
     Advanced knowledge of Python, scientific computing tools and cloud computing are required.
     Previous experience with software best practices, including continuous-integration pipelines, unit testing, code review. 
    Working knowledge of quantum computing algorithms and applications. Hybrid classical/quantum algorithms are included.
     Extensive experience with Machine Learning / AI algorithms. 
    Hands-on knowledge with LLM and frameworks such as Langchain. Experience with Fine tuning or training LLMs.
     If you have open-source contributions or your own code repositories it will be a plus.
     Experience in technical writing in a scientific or technical field. Demonstrated research ability.
     Self-motivated with a willingness to learn new things continuously
     Must be results-oriented and have a proven ability to get things done through people, including those not under direct management. 
    High level of professionalism. 
   
   
   Join our compact yet impactful team that is set to redefine the way we do business. In this role, you will:
   
     Innovate by building innovative LLM (Language Learning Model) applications, including single-agent, multi-agents, structural data extraction, knowledge graphs, and more.
     Construct robust systems, pipelines, and processes for dataset creation and preparations, serving as the backbone of our machine learning experiments.
     Fine-tune, train, and optimize prompts, LLMs, and embeddings, leveraging feedback from deployments or ad-hoc manual annotation process to refine our AI capabilities.
   
  
 
  
  For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is $184,100.00 to $294,500.00, depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. This range is based on a full-time position. In addition to base salary, this role may be eligible for a completion bonus. Moody’s also offers insurance and a discounted employee stock purchase plan for limited duration employees.  Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender, age, religion, national origin, citizen status, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody’s also provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities or based on a sincerely held religious belief in accordance with applicable laws. If you need to inquire about a reasonable accommodation, or need assistance with completing the application process, please email accommodations@moodys.com. descriptionHTML:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

The Role / Responsibilities:

The Director, AI and Quantum Research Engineer is a core member of Moody’s Analytics CX&I Research Team, reporting the Managing Director of AI and Quantum. This role will have responsibilities from both the AI and Quantum Computing teams, and will explore and research in areas such as Generative AI and LLMs, as well as Quantum Machine Learning.

As the Director - AI and Quantum Research Engineer, you will be instrumental in expanding our Quantum machine learning capabilities, crafting visionary products that enhances the customer experience in a very hands on way. You will have the unique opportunity to lead the change in our GenAI, ML and Quantum initiatives, harnessing the power of Moody’s Analytics vast data resources. This is more than a job. It is an opportunity to shape the future of AI and Quantum in the financial industry.

In this role you will be hands-on, and you will evaluate current literature, participate in the research community, and develop solutions in partnership with domain experts across the company. You are expected to have an elevated level of autonomy and capacity to learn new skills and domains, including the ability to learn advanced scientific and technical concepts quickly and with minimal direction, along with demonstrated experience in teaching others. You are very passionate about quantum computing and its implications on the financial industry.

Strong technical skills and a demonstrated ability to learn new concepts is important for this position. Experience in both quantum computing and software development is essential.

In your role you will:

  • Own and lead the conception and delivery of novel solutions to problems faced by internal project teams.
  • Develop new - and continually improve existing - AI Models or Quantum Algorithms for specific applications, in the team and in collaboration with external partners. Lead and manage the quantum innovation portfolio and pipeline, understanding the internal and external customer and business needs to recommend solutions where a quantum or quantum inspired approach may be optimal.
  • Provide guidance to other groups throughout Moody’s Analytics on best practices and advanced techniques.
  • Contribute to Moody’s IP by developing innovative solutions and use cases in collaboration with our partners and clients. The goal is to transform scientific research into business value.
  • Write white papers and build and maintain relationships with the external academic community and business community.
  • Consistently scan the market / competitors / partners / research, lead client engagements to understand challenges that they are trying to address and meet with external partners to bring innovative ideas and technologies to Moody’s Analytics.
  • Represent the company as a technical expert on quantum computing and present research findings to audiences internally and externally. Demonstrate thought leadership as it relates to QC, and actively seek ways to build MA’s “data and risk expertise” reputation externally (white papers, speaking panels, etc.). Partner with other ML groups inside the company to find hybrid solutions and benchmarks.

Qualifications/skills

  • BSc in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, or related field.
  • MSc, PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Math, or related field.
  • Advanced knowledge of Python, scientific computing tools and cloud computing are required.
  • Previous experience with software best practices, including continuous-integration pipelines, unit testing, code review.
  • Working knowledge of quantum computing algorithms and applications. Hybrid classical/quantum algorithms are included.
  • Extensive experience with Machine Learning / AI algorithms.
  • Hands-on knowledge with LLM and frameworks such as Langchain. Experience with Fine tuning or training LLMs.
  • If you have open-source contributions or your own code repositories it will be a plus.
  • Experience in technical writing in a scientific or technical field. Demonstrated research ability.
  • Self-motivated with a willingness to learn new things continuously
  • Must be results-oriented and have a proven ability to get things done through people, including those not under direct management.
  • High level of professionalism.

Join our compact yet impactful team that is set to redefine the way we do business. In this role, you will:

  • Innovate by building innovative LLM (Language Learning Model) applications, including single-agent, multi-agents, structural data extraction, knowledge graphs, and more.
  • Construct robust systems, pipelines, and processes for dataset creation and preparations, serving as the backbone of our machine learning experiments.
  • Fine-tune, train, and optimize prompts, LLMs, and embeddings, leveraging feedback from deployments or ad-hoc manual annotation process to refine our AI capabilities.

For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is $184,100.00 to $294,500.00, depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. This range is based on a full-time position. In addition to base salary, this role may be eligible for a completion bonus. Moody’s also offers insurance and a discounted employee stock purchase plan for limited duration employees.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender, age, religion, national origin, citizen status, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody’s also provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities or based on a sincerely held religious belief in accordance with applicable laws. If you need to inquire about a reasonable accommodation, or need assistance with completing the application process, please email accommodations@moodys.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only, and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

For San Francisco positions, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

This position may be considered a promotional opportunity, pursuant to the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

      1335 
     
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    Description and Requirements 
   
  
  
   
    
     
      Role Value Proposition: 
      As a Senior Salesforce Software Development Engineer you are responsible for the design, development, implementation and maintenance of solutions for MetLife’s Customer Solutions Center; focusing on Einstein AI capabilities and solutions. You will create functionality and solve problems in Salesforce software using a variety of web languages, software programs, and technologies. Timely and quality delivery of these solutions is based on a set of standards and processes which establish consistency across the enterprise, data, reduce risk, and promote efficiencies in support of the organization and the business goals and objectives. You will have an opportunity to impact every part of the system, foster and cultivate your curiosity and iterate over solutions to be the very best you can be to deliver for our customers. This role sits within a smaller team which provides the opportunity for the right person to take ownership of broader responsibilities, such as Scrum Lead who can support various releases and as support assisting the Product Owner of multiple products with the full-stack engineering responsibilities being the primary focus. 
      Key Responsibilities:
       
      
       Participates in the creation of Salesforce architectural specifications, ensuring feasibility, functionality, and integration with existing systems/platforms. 
       Responsible for detailed technical design and development of Salesforce Applications ensuring they accommodate the dynamic nature of AI technologies. 
       Develop architectural guidelines and standard processes for AI model development. 
       Partner with product and engineering teams to discover AI related reusable datasets, design patterns, components, libraries, and infrastructure to help optimize cost and find multi-functional commonalities. 
       Proactively identify potential architectural risks and develop strategies to mitigate them, safeguarding the integrity and security of our AI solutions 
       Investigate and resolve production management incidents, problems, and service requests. 
       Identifies and implements operating efficiency solutions for specific product feature. 
       Assists in upgrading or patching applications/platforms as needed. 
       Gain awareness of trends and issues in area of technical expertise, potential new technologies or technology opportunities to champion the customer.
      
       
       
      Essential Business Experience and Technical Skills: 
      Required: 
      
       Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field 
       5+ years of proven experience as a Salesforce Developer or in a similar senior technical role 
       Certified Salesforce Developer with experience in Lightning, Apex, and custom development 
       Track record of building large-scale innovative AI products and solutions 
       Proficiency with, at least, web languages such as JavaScript, Typescript, PHP 
       Proficiency with various database technologies and solutions, including both SQL and NoSQL 
       Proficiency with modern web framework such as Node.js, AngularJS or VueJS 
       Cross functional leadership: organize, motivate, and lead those outside of the team 
      
      Preferred: 
      
       Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and predictive analytics 
       Strong familiarity with Generative AI concepts and technologies, and understanding of different LLMs 
       Experience with Python, Jupyter Notebook, and API or data analysis libraries such as Pandas or NumPy 
       Experience in building the LWC components in Salesforce Lighting App 
       DevOps practices for CI/CD, release management, and automation using Azure DevOps, Selenium, JUnit, or similar technologies 
       Git-based repositories such as GitHub, Bitbucket or Azure Repos 
       Microsoft Azure Services: Functions, Kubernetes, CosmosDB, Storage, App Service 
      
     
    
    
     
      
       Equal Employment Opportunity/Disability/Veterans
       
         If you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email us at accommodations@metlife.com. This information will be held in confidence and used only to determine an appropriate accommodation for the application process.
       
       
       
         MetLife maintains a drug-free workplace.

positionName: Machine Learning Ops Engineer(Generative AI) BCIV16
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION/REQUIREMENTS:
1. Collaborate closely with customer stakeholders to understand their requirements, goals, and expectations for generative AI solutions.
2. Design, develop, and implement generative AI architectures, models, and solutions that meet customer needs and align with industry best practices.
3. Work cross-functionally with other teams, including data engineers, software developers, and project managers, to ensure the successful delivery of end-to-end AI projects.
4. Hands-on experience with advanced machine learning, data mining, statistical inference, mathematical modeling, and deep learning techniques.
5. Communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, translating complex AI concepts into clear, understandable language.
6. Provide expert guidance and advice as a consultant to help customers maximize the value of their generative AI investments.
7. Monitor and evaluate the performance of generative AI models, identify areas for improvement, and implement strategies to optimize solutions.
8. Stay current with the latest advancements in generative AI, machine learning, and related technologies, and incorporate new ideas and techniques into the team's work.
9. Mentor and guide junior team members in adopting generative AI technologies and best practices.
LOCATION: Plano, TX (Onsite)
POSITION: C2C 6+ month contract
SALARY: $60- $63.00 Hourly
NOTE: Please provide the city and state that you reside in and indicate if you are willing to relocate on your resume.
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $60.00 - $63.00 per year

description:
Why Patients Need You
 
 
   Technology impacts everything we do. Pfizer’s digital and ‘data first’ strategy focuses on implementing impactful and innovative technology solutions across all functions from research to manufacturing. Whether you are digitizing drug discovery and development, identifying solutions, or making our work easier and faster, you will be making a difference to countless lives.
 
 
 
   What You Will Achieve
 
 
   The Pfizer Intelligent Assistance Solutions Team is responsible for the strategy and execution of Machine Learning (ML), Natural Language Process (NLP) and Applied Artificial Intelligence (Applied AI) related programs across the enterprise. It’s mission is to innovate, build, deliver and maintain Applied AI and Generative AI base solutions, products and platforms that enable Pfizer to connect digitally with all our customers.
 
 
 
   The Intelligent Assistance Solutions Team seeks a Machine Learning (ML) Lead Data who will be dedicated to leveraging data, advanced analytics, machine/deep learning, and recent advances in NLP and Generative AI to create breakthrough solutions that change patients lives.
 
 
 
   Day-to-day, the ML Lead will actively support a high performing team of ML/NLP engineers to evaluate innovative open-source and commercial ML/NLP based models, methods and pipelines that are critical to developing breakthroughs AI solutions. The team will evaluate and execute on high priority use cases to exhibit proof of value and work in collaboration with AI engineering and platform function, to industrialize solutions into products.
 
 
 
   How You Will Achieve It
 
 
   Work closely with teams across Pfizer to maximize the use of NLP and Generative AI capabilities to support efforts focused on digitizing the enterprise by redefining existing internal business processes and how Pfizer engages with patients and healthcare providers
  
   
     Develop efficient analytic pipelines that include components related to data acquisition, exploratory analysis, feature engineering, modeling, and interactive storytelling.
   
   Management, mentorship and development of 2-46-8 Data Science/data science and/or AI ML engineering colleagues
   Lead and execute on high value Proof of Concepts related to NLP and Generative AI
   Serve as key point-of-contact for AI/ML-based opportunity assessment activities
   Co-develop ML-based analytic AI re-usable microservices such as Entity Extractors, Sentiment Analyzers, Document Summarizers that will serve as the foundation for a scalable Applied AI solutions and products across Pfizer
   Co-develop common patterns and approaches for building end to end NLP pipelines
   Establish the right balance between POC delivery and maintenance, managing technical debt, and ML-focused exploratory investigations for new product ideas
   Manage delivery goals through a combination of good planning, removing obstacles, technical mentoring, reviewing work, and fostering positive collaboration with product, design and other engineering teams
   Partner with other Data Science & Advanced Analytics oriented groups within Pfizer to develop common tools & approaches through participation in formal/informal community of practice activities.
   Directly engage and clearly communicate vision and business value of ML-based initiatives to key business stake-holders (Director/Sr. Director/VP level)
   Informal leaders Shared-ownership of advancing team's capabilities in innovative areas
   Contribute to critical talent acquisition and development activities through external partnerships and co-sponsored hackathons
 
 
 
   Qualifications
 
 
   Must-Have
 
 
   10+ years prior work experience in Life Science, Healthcare or associated consulting practice
   10+ years of work experience as a software engineer in machine learning, knowledge graphs, and data science
   6+ years of experience directly managing a team of software engineers or data scientists
   6+ years of hands-on programming experience in at least one of the following: SQL, Python, JAVA, C/C++
   5+ years ML coding experience (statistical learning, deep learning, Tensorflow/Keras, GCP/AWS)
   3+ years experience working within AWS Ecosystem
   Demonstrated track record of recruiting excellent engineers and data scientists and building a strong technical benchmark
   Strong knowledge of agile scrum practices and experience in using those methods to deliver complex solutions
   Ability to create technical examples, prototypes, and demonstrations based on rapidly changing data & tool sets
   Ability to thrive in a fast-paced multi-disciplinary environment; with the ability to effectively communicate with a diverse audience
   Experience Demonstrated experience with mature and emerging machine learning models, statistical modeling; supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning techniques critical for advancing Pfizer’s AI intelligent services objectives
   Demonstrated success embedding ML algorithms in production applications and applying MLOps in practice
   Ability to educate business users on AI and ML concepts in laymen terms
   Strong written and verbal communications skills
 
 
 
   GENERAL SKILLS REQUIREMENTS
 
 
   Advisor/Consultancy: Provides well-informed advice, typically within a specific technical specialization, ensuring that it is properly understood and appropriately exploited, to enhance the effectiveness of significant activities. Provides advice on technical aspects of Conversational UI and ensures that relevant technical strategies, policies, standards and practices are applied correctly.
   Technical Acumen: Maintains knowledge of specific technologies provides detailed advice regarding their application, executes specialized tasks.
   Thought Leadership & Advocacy: Develop awareness of industry developments and best practices Provide thought leadership in emerging technologies as they relate to AI and Conversational UI
   Presentation Skills: Ability to develop visually simple and appealing PowerPoint presentations and be comfortable with articulating and communicating with the right authority and messaging to a broad range of stakeholders
 
 
   Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.
 
 
 
   NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS
 
 
   3-4 Days in the office. 10% local travel and flexibility to work across global time zones
 
 
   Work Location Assignment: Flexible
 
 
   Additional Posting Locations: La Jolla, CA; Cambridge, MA; New York, NY; Collegeville, PA
 
 
   Last Date to Apply for Job: 1/23/2024
 
  The annual base salary for this position ranges from $118,100.00 to $196,800.00. In addition, this position is eligible for participation in Pfizer’s Global Performance Plan with a bonus target of 17.5% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. Learn more at Pfizer Candidate Site – U.S. Benefits | (uscandidates.mypfizerbenefits.com). Pfizer compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided applies to the Tampa, FL location only. The salary range provided does not apply to any other United States location or locations outside of the United States.
 
 
   Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.
 
 
 
  
   
    
     
      
       
        
         
           Sunshine Act
         
         
           Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.
         
        
       
      
     
    
   
  
 
 
 
  
   
    
     
      
       
        
         
           EEO & Employment Eligibility
         
         
           Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.
         
        
       
      
     
    
   
  
 
  Information & Business Tech

Learn more at Pfizer Candidate Site – U.S. Benefits | (uscandidates.mypfizerbenefits.com). Pfizer compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided applies to the Tampa, FL location only. The salary range provided does not apply to any other United States location or locations outside of the United States.
Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.
Sunshine Act
Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.
EEO & Employment Eligibility
Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.
Information & Business Tech

description:
About Rivian: 
 
   Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.
 
 
 
   As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.
  Role Summary: 
 
   The Smart Diagnostics team at Rivian supports developing and deploying Rivian’s Smart Diagnostics AI system that drives in-vehicle and remote diagnostics using traditional ML and Generative AI. We focus on diagnosis, prognosis, predictive service, and maintenance of Rivian vehicles. Internal teams and Rivian vehicle owners alike use our systems.
 
 
   We operate highly scalable infrastructure for serving and orchestrating LLMs, Vector Stores, and agents. This role will be focused on delivering quality software and backend services, enhancing the utility of GenAI frameworks, and exploring the bleeding edge of this new technology.
  Responsibilities: 
 
  Work with LLM and AI/ML systems to drive impact through automation.
   Focus on multimodal inputs: text, image, audio, or video.
   Designed and developed production backend distributed systems and micro-services at scale.
   Be thoughtful about the customer experience and limitations of modern AI systems.
   Be a subject matter expert on ML infrastructure for internal and external customers.
   Willing to support on-call rotation as needed for Production systems.
  Qualifications: 
 
  Bachelor's degree in CS or any STEM discipline.
   Hands-on experience in training/finetuning/scaling up traditional ML models and LLMs, multimodal LLMs, efficient models, RL, RLHF, or RLAIF.
   Familiarity with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch.
   Prior experience training and finetuning models for text/image/audio tasks.
   Knowledge of Cloud fundamentals (preferably in AWS) and distributed systems.
   Robust system and component-level design and troubleshooting skills, including memory and CPU profiling on cloud-based services.
   Strong coding skills in one or more programming languages – Golang, Python, Rust, Java. Must include knowledge of how-to unit tests and system tests.
   Familiarity with CI/CD, Git, and Release Management.
   Prior automotive experience is a plus.
   Ph.D. or MS a plus.
  Pay Disclosure: 
 
  Salary Range/Hourly Rate for California Based Applicants: $205,000.00 - $236,000.00 (actual compensation will be determined based on experience, location, and other factors permitted by law).
 
  
 
 
   Benefits Summary: Rivian provides robust medical/Rx, dental and vision insurance packages for full-time employees, their spouse or domestic partner, and children up to age 26. Coverage is effective on the first day of employment, and Rivian covers most of the premiums.
  Company Statements: 
 Equal Opportunity
 
   Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.
 
 
 
   Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.
 
  Candidate Data Privacy
 
   Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.
 
 
 
   Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.
 
 
 
   Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions.
 
 
 
   Please note that we are currently not accepting applications from third party application services.

description:
The era of pervasive AI has arrived. In this era, organizations will use generative AI to unlock hidden value in their data, accelerate processes, reduce costs, drive efficiency and innovation to fundamentally transform their businesses and operations at scale. 
   SambaNova Suite™ is the first full-stack, generative AI platform, from chip to model, optimized for enterprise and government organizations. Powered by the intelligent SN40L chip, the SambaNova Suite is a fully integrated platform, delivered on-premises or in the cloud, combined with state-of-the-art open-source models that can be easily and securely fine-tuned using customer data for greater accuracy. Once adapted with customer data, customers retain model ownership in perpetuity, so they can turn generative AI into one of their most valuable assets.
 
  Working at SambaNova 
  This role presents a unique opportunity to shape the future of AI and the value it can unlock across every aspect of an organization's business and operations As customers adopt and implement AI solutions, this individual contributor will provide technical leadership and support for SambaNova Systems products. This is a high-visibility position where the individual contributor will be a customer engineer who works with our most strategic customers in the region. This role allows for both external and internal collaboration across the customer, engineering, and product to ensure a smooth customer support experience.   
 Job Description 
  SambaNova is hiring a post-sales Customer Engineer who will be responsible for the success of specific customers as they deploy solutions with SambaNova Systems. You will work with identified customers to make sure everything involving their deployment and interactions goes smoothly.   
 The ideal candidate will have extensive, hands-on experience in system engineering, software, and managing technical customer relationships in enterprise or cloud systems or software, paired with strong relationship and collaborative skills to engage with others and achieve outstanding customer success.
  
  
  Experience with AI/ML market, customer needs, and technologies 
  Expertise with system engineering concepts 
  Exceptional customer relationship skills 
  Experience with both hardware and software technologies 
  Hands-on technical deployment skills 
  Superior analytical and problem-solving skills 
  Team-oriented and collaborative by nature 
  Ability to address multiple internal and external stakeholders clearly and concisely 
  Ability to manage multiple tasks with competing priorities 
  
 This individual will be responsible for: 
  
  Own customer-related technical activities and relationships, including product adoption and implementation, support, etc. 
  Be a trusted advisor and key technical resource for identified customers 
  Become an expert in SambaNova Systems products 
  Resolve technical problems where possible and work with development to deliver solutions for advanced issues 
  Complete technical work with a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders in a timely and efficient manner 
  Communicate effectively with a diverse audience of internal and external stakeholders 
  Translate business cases and requirements into appropriate technical solutions 
  Demonstrate, architect, design and deliver solutions with SambaNova Systems with appropriate value propositions and technical merit 
  Gather customer feedback and communicate back to the engineering team in a prioritized manner to influence bug fixes and next-generation products 
  Present and demonstrate SambaNova Systems at external community events like trade shows and conferences 
  Assist with creating and maintaining product documentation, best practices, demos, and other customer-facing documentation 
  Travel to customers and trade shows as required 
  Some responsibility for off-hours support during significant events as required
 
  
  Basic Qualifications 
  
  Bachelor's degree with a technical focus 
  Minimum 5 years experience with external customers 
  Travel to customer site occasionally 
  
 Additional Required Qualifications 
  
  Hands-on troubleshooting of deep learning models for accuracy, performance, and other important customer attributes 
  Deep learning in NLP or CV; proof-of-concepts and solutions are a plus 
  Python and PyTorch experience for a minimum of 2 years 
  Experience with systems, including Linux OS and hardware 
  
 Preferred Qualifications 
  
  Experience working in a high-growth startup 
  A team player who demonstrates humility 
  Action-oriented with a focus on speed and results 
  Ability to thrive in a no-boundaries culture and make an impact on innovation 
  
 Annual Salary Range and Level 
  The base salary for this position ranges from $145,000.00/year up to $180,000.00/year. This range is based on role, level, and location and reflects the salary target for new hires in the US. Individual pay within the range will depend on several factors, including a candidate's job-related qualifications, skills, competencies, experience, and location. 
  Benefits Summary 
  SambaNova offers a competitive total rewards package, including the base salary plus equity and benefits. We cover 95% premium coverage for employee medical insurance and 80% premium coverage for dependents, and we offer a Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer contribution. We also offer dental, vision, Short/Long term disability, basic life, voluntary life, and AD&D insurance plans, in addition to flexible spending account (FSA) options like health care, limited purpose, and dependent care. Our library of well-being benefits includes a full subscription to Headspace, access to One Medical, counseling services with an Employee Assistance Program, and much more. 
  #LI-TD1
 
   Benefits Summary for US-Based Full-Time Direct Employment Positions 
   (The Recruiter will provide benefit details for non-US-based roles) 
   SambaNova offers a competitive total rewards package, including the base salary, plus equity and benefits. We cover 95% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, and 77% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer contribution. We also offer Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life, and AD&D insurance plans in addition to Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options like Health Care, Limited Purpose, and Dependent Care. Our library of well-being benefits available to you and your dependents includes a full subscription to Headspace, Gympass+ membership with access to physical gyms, One Medical membership, counseling services with an Employee Assistance Program, and much more.
   
   
   Submission Guidelines 
   Please note that in order to be considered an applicant for any position at SambaNova Systems, you must submit an application form for each position for which you believe you are qualified. 
   If you are a new, recent (within the last two years), or upcoming college graduate and are interested in opportunities with SambaNova Systems, please apply through our university job listings.
   
   
   EEO Policy 
   SambaNova Systems is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard basis of age (40 and over), color, disability, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, military or veteran status, national origin/ancestry, race, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding), sexual orientation, and any other applicable status protected by federal, state, or local laws.  Customers turn to SambaNova to quickly deploy state-of-the-art generative AI capabilities within the enterprise. Our purpose-built enterprise-scale AI platform is the technology backbone for the next generation of AI computing.  Headquartered in Palo Alto, California, SambaNova Systems was founded in 2017 by industry luminaries, and hardware and software design experts from Sun/Oracle and Stanford University. Investors include SoftBank Vision Fund 2, funds and accounts managed by BlackRock, Intel Capital, GV, Walden International, Temasek, GIC, Redline Capital, Atlantic Bridge Ventures, Celesta, and several others. Visit us at sambanova.ai. Follow SambaNova Systems on Linkedin.

positionName: Senior AI and Machine Learning Engineer
location: 2788 San Tomas Expressway, Santa Clara, CA 95051
description:
At NVIDIA, we are at the forefront of advancing the capabilities of artificial intelligence. We are seeking an ambitious and forward-thinking deep learning researcher to contribute to the development of next-generation optimizations aimed at efficiently serving generative AI at scale. In this role, you will be developing and exploring new cutting-edge AI optimization techniques, operating at the intersection of algorithms, hardware, and software stacks.
 
 
 
   As Nvidia makes significant strides in the Datacenter business, our team holds a central role in maximizing the efficiency of our exponentially growing datacenter deployments and establishing a data-driven approach to hardware design and system software development. We collaborate extensively with diverse teams at Nvidia, spanning deep learning research and framework development teams, to silicon architecture. Thriving in such a high-impact, interdisciplinary environment necessitates not only technical proficiency but also a growth mindset and a pragmatic attitude — qualities that fuel our collective success in shaping the future of datacenter technology.
 
 
 
   What You'll Be Doing:
 
 
  
   
     Keeping abreast of the latest advancements in generative AI research.
   
  
   
     Implementing and benchmarking cutting-edge large language and multi-modal models, analyzing their emergent patterns and system performance bottlenecks.
   
  
   
     Pioneering the development of innovative optimizations to effectively lower the operational costs associated with deploying generative AI models at large scale.
   
  
   
     Collaborating closely with production teams to incorporate the latest research advancements into cutting-edge hardware and/or software frameworks.
   
 
 
 
   What We Need to See:
 
 
  
   
     A minimum qualification of a Master's degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Applied Mathematics, or related fields. PhD a plus
   
  
   
     A strong foundation in deep learning, with a particular emphasis on generative models.
   
  
   
     6+ years of relevant software development experience in modern deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch.
   
  
   
     Growth mindset and pragmatic attitude.
   
 
 
 
   Ways to Stand Out From the Crowd:
 
 
  
   
     Published research or noteworthy contributions to the field of deep learning, particularly around algorithm development for efficient deployment at scale.
   
  
   
     Experience with benchmarking accuracy and performance of AI models.
   
  
   
     Experience with CUDA programming and GPU performance optimizations.
   
  
   
     Familiarity with computer architecture and how it relates to AI algorithms development.
   
 
 
 
   NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people on the planet working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!
 
  The base salary range is 176,000 USD - 333,500 USD. Your base salary will be determined based on your location, experience, and the pay of employees in similar positions.
 
  
   
    
     
      
       
        
          You will also be eligible for equity and 
         
          benefits
         . 
         NVIDIA accepts applications on an ongoing basis.
        
       
      
     
    
   
  
 
  NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

description:
Join SADA as a Senior Enterprise Cloud Architect, Data Engineering 
  Your Mission 
  As a Senior Enterprise Cloud Architect at SADA, with a specialization in Data and Analytics you will have significant knowledge and experience with "everything data." You will have held different roles throughout your extensive career enabling you to work with many different technologies and industries. As part of your role, you will collaborate with various teams, including customers, engineering, sales, and Googlers. 
  You will be responsible for overseeing Data & Analytics projects for large and intricate client engagements, sometimes acting as our "account CTO." You'll run discovery calls, workshops, etc with customers, Google and internally at SADA. You'll provide estimations and work on Statements of Work (SOW) and related supporting material. You will design world class data-architectures and solve hard problems. 
  You will have a hands-on approach, researching and presenting solutions, conducting experiments, and building prototypes to validate ideas and demonstrate the effectiveness of the solutions you recommend. You will also spearhead the implementation of projects and lead other engineers to deliver on your architectural vision. 
  SADA is a services-focused company and you will have the opportunity to support customers spanning every industry-including gaming, logistics, financial, healthcare, retail and SaaS-each with different use cases and objectives. You will obtain a breadth of skills and experience unparalleled at other companies.
  
  
  What you would be doing on a daily basis: 
  
  Work on different types of projects in various stages of development, including pre-sales/scoping, discovery, and architecting solutions 
  Oversee executing projects that could include greenfield data warehouse implementations, database re-platforming, data consolidation, data warehouse migrations and modernizations in GCP 
  Prototype Proof of Concepts for customer/team feedback 
  Quality-Review solutions delivered by other engineers on the project 
  Deliver hands-on technical mentoring and leadership to engineers on the project, especially when using niche architectural patterns. Keep the communication channels with the client transparent to update on progress, gather feedback, and evaluate opportunities. 
  Assist the Project Managers and Clients in making high-impact decisions to improve the quality/time-to-market of the delivery where relevant. 
  Research and develop new processes and patterns to improve the quality and efficiency of future project delivery 
  Stay on the cutting edge of new developments of data products, services, and patterns
 
  
  
  Pathway to Success 
  Your super-power will be in helping customers understand specifically how Google Cloud technology can fundamentally solve their business challenges with technology, enabling them to meet their goals.  You will inspire cross-functional leadership from our engineering teams. You will be trusted to guide large enterprise engagements and given the freedom to build new solutions that meet customer needs. 
  You will establish yourself as a renowned specialist within SADA, earning a reputation with customers and with the Google Cloud sales and professional services teams for your wide-ranging domain knowledge. Other engineers and architects will routinely defer to your expertise when it comes to the delivery of project architectures. In your role, you'll manage client-oriented technical conversations. Collaborating with client architects and technology heads, you will take on the design of expansive and extended client initiatives. 
  Success will be measured by Client satisfaction, deals won, and by your contributions to the team's goals. 
  Expectations 
  Required Travel - Up to 25% travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events.
  
  
  Customer Facing - This is a customer-facing role. You will interact with customers on a daily basis. You will participate in calls and customer meetings to qualify for consultative engagements with engineering and business teams. You will present solutions, architectures, SOWs, demos, and other technical materials to build trust and confidence in SADA's ability to take the customer through their cloud adoption. 
  Onboarding/Training - The first several weeks of onboarding are dedicated to learning and will encompass learning materials/assignments and compliance training, as well as meetings with relevant individuals. Details of the timeline are shared closer to the start date. 
  Job Requirements 
  Required Credentials: 
  
  Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or 10 years of relevant work experience in software development. 
  
 Google Professional Data Engineer or able to complete one of the above within the first 90 days of employment. 
  Required Qualifications: 
  
  Minimum of 10 years of experience in data engineering and architecture, with a focus on cloud-based environments. 
  Demonstrated experience designing and deploying scalable, reliable, and enterprise-grade data solutions and managing them in production. 
  Expertise in development with languages commonly used in data processing, such as Spark, SQL, Python, or Java. 
  Prior experience in designing, building, and managing robust, user-friendly data pipelines. 
  Experience in leading intricate, long-term customer projects. Examples may include transitioning from one cloud to another, modernizing legacy data warehouses and architectures or implementing large-scale new data products on the cloud. 
  Experience providing leadership, supervision, and direction in data-oriented projects, ideally in a high-growth organization. 
  Experience in strategizing, designing, architecting, and leading the deployment of scalable data solutions with a focus on cloud-based systems. 
  Experience facilitating technical design sessions, architecting and documenting data solutions aligned with client business objectives, and identifying gaps between the client's current and desired end states. 
  Ability to evaluate and select suitable technologies and frameworks to meet specific data project needs, while assessing risks and trade-offs. 
  Proficiency in designing and implementing scalable, high-performance, and secure data architectures. 
  Ability to architect, scope, and prioritize work based on feedback from the customer or internal teams. 
  Experience working with customers in a consulting capacity, including persuading them to adopt more efficient technologies and processes. 
  Deep understanding of various types of databases including analytical, relational and NoSQL. 
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
  Time management skills with the ability to manage multiple streams. 
  Enthusiasm for learning new technologies, industry trends, and best practices in data architecture and cloud computing. 
  Ability to quickly adapt to changing business requirements and technologies in a fast-paced environment delivering real-time data applications using streaming data technologies like Apache Kafka, Google Cloud Pub/Sub, or Amazon Kinesis. 
  Experience using Google Cloud Platform, particularly serverless (Cloud Functions) and platforms (Dataflow, BigQuery, DataProc, DataForm). 
  
 Bonus Qualifications: 
  
  Familiarity with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker. 
  Experience with Machine Learning, AI, and Generative AI 
  Experience with cloud data offerings and solutions (Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS).
 
 
 
   About SADA An Insight company 
   Values: SADA stands for inclusion, fairness, and doing the right thing. From our very beginning, we've championed a diverse workplace where we support and learn from each other, amplifying the impact we make with our customers. We're proud that our teams are composed of contributors who represent a wide array of backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer. Our five core values are the foundation of everything we do: 
   
   
    Make Them Rave
    
   
    Be Data Driven
    
   
    Think One Step Ahead
    
   
    Drive Purposeful Impact
    
   
    Do The Right Thing
    
   
  Work with the Best: SADA has been the largest Google Cloud partner in North America since 2016 and, for the sixth year in a row, has been named a Google Global Partner of the Year . This year, SADA was named a Google Cloud Global Partner of the year 2023. SADA has also been awarded Best Place to Work year after year by the Business Intelligence Group and Inc. Magazine, and was recognized as a Niche Player in the 2023 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Public Cloud IT Transformation Services. 
   Benefits: Unlimited PTO, paid parental leave, competitive and attractive compensation, performance-based bonuses, paid holidays, generous medical, dental, vision plans, life, short and long-term disability insurance, 401K/RRSP with match, as well as Google-certified training programs and a professional development stipend. 
   Business Performance: SADA has been named to the INC 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies list for the last 10+ years in a row, garnering Honoree status. CRN has also named SADA on the Top 500 Global Solutions Providers list for the past 5 years. The overall culture continues to evolve with engineering at its core: 3200+ projects completed, 4000+ customers served, 10K+ workloads, and 30M+ users migrated to the cloud. 
   To request reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, contact careers@sada.com. SADA complies with federal and state/provincial disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and candidates with disabilities.

You will have a hands-on approach, researching and presenting solutions, conducting experiments, and building prototypes to validate ideas and demonstrate the effectiveness of the solutions you recommend. Google Professional Data Engineer or able to complete one of the above within the first 90 days of employment.

  • Ability to evaluate and select suitable technologies and frameworks to meet specific data project needs, while assessing risks and trade-offs.
